org.harctoolbox.devslashlirc

Class Mode2LircDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.harctoolbox.devslashlirc.LircHardware
      • org.harctoolbox.devslashlirc.LircDevice
        • org.harctoolbox.devslashlirc.Mode2LircDevice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, IMode2

    public class Mode2LircDevice
extends LircDevice
implements IMode2
    This class models a /dev/lirc device of the mode2 type, that is, capable of sending and/or receiving according to raw timing information.

      • send

        public void send(int[] data)
          throws NotSupportedException
        Description copied from interface: IMode2
        Sends the provided data as a sequence of durations. The data is send without setting the modulation frequency, so the exact outcome may depend on the hardware, or on previously sent commands.
        Specified by:
        send in interface IMode2
        Parameters:
        data - interger array of durations.
        Throws:
        NotSupportedException - if the hardware does not support sending.

      • send

        public void send(int[] data,
                 int frequency)
          throws NotSupportedException
        Description copied from interface: IMode2
        Sends the provided data as a sequence of durations. The data is send without setting the modulation frequency, so the exact outcome may depend on the hardware, or on previously sent commands.
        Specified by:
        send in interface IMode2
        Parameters:
        data - interger array of durations.
        frequency - Frequency in Hz.
        Throws:
        NotSupportedException - if the hardware does not support sending, or setting of the modulation frequency.
